content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You are fairly open to taking risks but still prefer to assess the situation carefully. You are not reckless, but you are not overly cautious either. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player, I would approach this game with a strategy that aims to maximize my earnings over the 75 rounds while keeping in mind that my opponent is also trying to do the same. Since we are not given any information about the behavior of the anonymous player, I will have to make an assumption or use a general strategy.

One possible strategy is to adopt a mixed strategy, where I don't stick to one choice (either R or B) throughout the game but vary my choices to ensure a more balanced outcome. In this case, if I choose R 50% of the time and B 50% of the time, I can expect an average payoff of 28.75$ per round [(0.5 * 45) + (0.5 * 12)].

Over 75 rounds, my expected total earnings would be approximately 2106.25$. If my opponent adopts a similar strategy, we will both earn around 2106.25$ each. However, it is important to note that the actual outcome could differ due to the randomness of our choices.

Another possibility is to assume that the anonymous player is rational and will adopt a similar mixed strategy as well. In this case, my best response would be to choose the same mixed strategy, ensuring a balanced outcome in the long run.

In summary, I would choose a mixed strategy where I pick R 50% of the time and B 50% of the time {R} as my initial choice for this game. It's essential to remember that the actual outcome could differ due to the randomness of our choices and the specific strategy adopted by the anonymous player.
